meanings.definition: A person or thing competing with another for the same objective or for superiority in the same field of activity.
meanings.sent1: In the race, the two rivals sprinted towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The two basketball teams are fierce rivals on the court.
meanings.sent3: The rivals in the cooking competition were determined to win the top prize.
meanings.sent4: The rivals in the business world constantly strive to outdo each other.
meanings.sent5: The rivals in the spelling bee practiced diligently to outspell each other.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that equals another in quality or strength.
meanings.sent1: Her skills as a pianist make her a worthy rival to the famous musician.
meanings.sent2: The two chess players were evenly matched rivals in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The rival in the video game was a tough opponent to beat.
meanings.sent4: The rival in the boxing ring proved to be a formidable challenger.
meanings.sent5: The rival in the art competition showcased impressive talent.

meanings.definition: To be or seem to be equal or comparable to.
meanings.sent1: His performance on the track rivals that of the Olympic athletes.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant aims to rival the popular eatery across the street.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to rival the dog's tricks was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to rival her sister's success was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The student's artwork rivaled that of the professional painters.
